title: Bananagrams
curation_notes:
There are 144* tiles in the game; they are: A=13, B=3, C=3, D=6, E=18, F=3, G=4, H=3, I=12, J=2, K=2, L=5, M=3, N=8, O=11, P=3, Q=2, R=9, S=6, T=9, U=6, V=3, W=3, X=2, Y=3, Z=2.
*WildTiles has 150 tiles, plus Wild=6.

Some have tried in the past to mark the tiles with permanent marker. It does not go well.

title: The Climbers
curation_notes:
Components
• 2 large beige blocks (triple cubes)
• 12 cloured blocks, size “1” (half cubes)
• 12 cloured blocks, size “2” (cubes)
• 9 coloured blocks size “4” (double cubes)
All blocks except the grey ones have the
following colours on opposing sides:
Red / Yellow
Dark blue / Light blue
Purple / grey
• 5 short ladders
• 5 long ladders
• 5 coloured figures
• 5 coloured blocking stones
Notes:
Through play the blocks can often chip through use (Mostly by people who think its weird Jenga).  I recommend keeping some paint handy of the appropriate colours to keep it looking fresh.  The Ladders can and will be ripped apart, glue them together firmly.  Game will often be put away willy nilly with the lid not firmly on.
